snippet: A federal judge ruled Thursday that the state must recognize hundreds of same-sex marriages performed during a brief window when they were allowed last year.
abstract: Federal Judge Mark Goldsmith orders Michigan to recognize hundreds of same-sex marriages that were conducted during brief window, following 2004 referendum allowing the marriages, before appeals court suspended decision.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge ruled Thursday that the state must recognize hundreds of same-sex marriages performed during a brief window when they were allowed last year.

headline.print_headline: Michigan: 300 Same-Sex Marriages Are Ruled Valid Pending Appeal
headline.main: Michigan: 300 Same-Sex Marriages Are Ruled Valid Pending Appeal

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
